image.altText: A yellow 'road closed' sign across a road with clothing and other items scattered in the background.

props.synopsis: The 48-year-old woman was struck by a utility on Bicentennial Drive at around 8:15am on Sunday. She died at the scene.Â

title.children: Female pedestrian dies after being hit by ute in Jerrabomberra

image.altText: a woman with dark red hair and a green top in a park

props.synopsis: She's one of many Canberra endometriosis patients who have been forced to go private for surgery, costing them thousands of dollars in the process.

title.children: Katherine waited more than three years for a surgery which could have eased some of her endometriosis pain

image.altText: A man wearing an orange SES shirt in bushland.

props.synopsis: No trace has ever been found of missing Cessna 210 VH-MDX, despite 43 years of searching Barrington Tops National Park.

title.children: VH-MDX vanished without a trace 43 years ago with five people onboard. These people are still searching

image.altText: An older man looks sternly ahead while sitting in his office.

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church has won a High Court appeal against rulings it is vicariously liable for the actions of a priest who allegedly sexually abused a five-year-old in 1971, sparking calls for change.

title.children: Who's responsible? High Court under fire over Catholic Church abuse case

image.altText: Nick leans against his red Mustang car, wearing a white shirt and jeans.

props.synopsis: When Canberran Nick Proud saw people standing at a bus stop looking confused during a surprise city-wide bus strike, he offered them free lifts in his 1964 Mustang.

title.children: When Canberra bus drivers called a snap strike, Nick gave strangers a lift in his Mustang

image.altText: A sign outside a tertiary education campus

props.synopsis: A consultant whose $5 million contract with the Canberra's Institute of Technology (CIT) was cancelled wins his battle to sue the organisation.

title.children: Consultant who sued CIT for breach of contract is awarded $2.4 million by Canberra court

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress smiles while holding up a glass award.

props.synopsis: The co-founder of an organisation helping children experiencing serious injury or illness avoid missing out on school, Megan Gilmour, is named 2025 Australian of the Year for the ACT.

title.children: After Megan's son missed over a year of school while chronically ill she promised not to turn her back on others like him

image.altText: The outside of a building with a large "Canberra Hospital'' sign.

props.synopsis: Canberra Health Services walks back a proposal to block non-ACT residents from accessing specialist medical appointments at the Canberra Hospital, as part of its plan to reduce massive patient backlogs.

title.children: Low category patients on dermatology waitlist 'unlikely' to be seen, ACT health minister concedes

image.altText: MIke Tyson congratulates Jake Paul

title.children: After Jake Paul mocked Mike Tyson, he uttered four words that nobody wanted to hear

image.altText: An aerial view of the Pacific Island of Kiribati, surrounded by turquoise water and a wisp of cloud.

props.synopsis: There are many problems with Australia's migration system. Climate change will cause more.Â

title.children: Is Australia's migration system ready for rising numbers of climate refugees?

image.altText: Prince William leans down with an overgrown beard and his lips pursed.

props.synopsis: Prince William has laid out his vision for his future reign but he is grappling with looming problems, including recent reporting over his inherited duchy, a squabble over a sweetheart rental deal and an ongoing feud with his brother Prince Harry.

title.children: With Prince Andrew given a reprieve from an 'anonymous donor', William inherits his father's real estate woes

image.altText: The newspaper column shows a before and after picture of an executive wife.

props.synopsis: In the 1970s, the way a wife conducted herself was almost equally important to her husband's career as his own abilities.

title.children: 'They wanted them to be perfect': The history of Australia's finishing schools for executive wives

image.altText: the outside of illawong public school in sydney's south with a tree in the front

image.altText: Jaxon Evans's car crashes into the wall

image.altText: A black and white photo of a car parked in front of a large house and forest

image.altText: Headshot of tongan king in crown and robe

title.children: Tonga is the only Pacific nation not to be colonised â so why did their king wear English clothes?

image.altText: An aerial view of a town

props.synopsis: Despite an aborted manslaughter prosecution last year, the coroner found the mistakes that led to the drowning represented "a systemic issue, rather than a failing of any one person".

title.children: Coroner refers council worker immunity to attorney-general after toddler's drowning death exposes 'inexcusable' failings

image.altText: Kelvin Smith wearing a red puffer jacket and beanie plays an upright piano atop kunanyi/Mount Wellington

props.synopsis: Kelvin Smith is known for playing his piano in picturesque locations around Tasmania. His latest feat, pushing his 240 kilogram instrument to the top of Hobart's kunanyi/Mount Wellington, has been six months in the making.

image.altText: A woman holds a child in her arms after a fire in India

image.altText: Man with two girls and two boys in front of a lake

title.children: Men urged to check their pecs after dad's shock breast cancer diagnosis

image.altText: GettyImages-942453
